intro: Hieracium kuzenevae, commonly known as the Kuznevoi hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow-orange composite flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, this species thrives in rocky and dry environments. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
